meta.title: Home | Toms River Regional School District

meta.name: description
meta.content: A community of dedicated students, professional staff, and supportive community members committed to providing an innovative and rigorous educational experience.

input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.a: Designated as a High Performing School District
AP National Honor Roll® by the College Board

div.strong: All TRRS schools have been closed in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and will remain closed until at least May 15.
div.span: Gov Murphy stated on 4/16 that schools will be closed through at least Friday, May 15. Updated information found here.

div.p: Click below to find out more about the funding crisis, including how YOU can make your voice heard.

div.data-title: Intermediate South Students Take Engineering Challenge
div.aria-label: Intermediate South Students Take Engineering Challenge

a.h3: Intermediate South Students Take Engineering Challenge

div.div: Back in early March, students in the Cycle 83 Academic Activity period at Intermediate South, competed with more than 4,900 students from 8 countries in the 2020 Fluor Engineering Challenge.

div.data-title: Students Extract DNA at Home
div.aria-label: Students Extract DNA at Home

a.h3: Students Extract DNA at Home

div.div: April 15, 2020-- Intermediate South students in cycle 82 have been conducting online DNA extractions in their science classes. While the online lab was fun, science teacher Ms.

div.data-title: Crystal Pan to Represent NJ at National STEM Competition
div.aria-label: Crystal Pan to Represent NJ at National STEM Competition

a.h3: Crystal Pan to Represent NJ at National STEM Competition

div.div: April 15, 2020-- Tomorrow, April 16, High School North senior authentic science research (ASR) student Crystal Pan will compete at the National Junior Science and Humanities Symposium.

div.data-title: Alumni Show Support for Students' Digital Learning Efforts
div.aria-label: Alumni Show Support for Students' Digital Learning Efforts

a.h3: Alumni Show Support for Students' Digital Learning Efforts

div.div: Major League Baseball star Todd Frazier and UFC champ Frankie Edgar-- both TRRS alum-- recently shared videos supporting East Dover students and their efforts with digital learning.

div.data-title: Still ‘High Performing’ With New Bar in School Operations Assessment
div.aria-label: Still ‘High Performing’ With New Bar in School Operations Assessment

a.h3: Still ‘High Performing’ With New Bar in School Operations Assessment

div.div: April 14, 2020-- After visiting Toms River Regional Schools in February and conducting its Quality Single Accountability Continuum (QSAC) review, the New Jersey Department of Education has once again distinguished the district as “high performing.

div.data-title: NEA Big Read Rescheduled for Fall
div.aria-label: NEA Big Read Rescheduled for Fall

a.h3: NEA Big Read Rescheduled for Fall

div.div: April 7, 2020-- The district's signature literacy program, for which it became a grantee for a third consecutive year in 2019-2020, has been rescheduled for fall 2020.

div.data-title: School Videos
div.aria-label: School Videos

a.h3: School Videos

div.div: A compilation of school videos produced over the past several weeks. The common theme: WE MISS YOU! We'll add to this gallery as more videos come in.

div.data-title: Autism Awareness Month a Time to Celebrate Differences
div.aria-label: Autism Awareness Month a Time to Celebrate Differences

a.h3: Autism Awareness Month a Time to Celebrate Differences

div.div: April 6, 2020-- April is Autism Awareness month, globally recognized as the time to promote acceptance and celebrate differences. Each year, the district strives to celebrate this month through various events and school-based activities.

div.data-title: Superintendent Healy's Community Letter Regarding Spring Break Change
div.aria-label: Superintendent Healy's Community Letter Regarding Spring Break Change

a.h3: Superintendent Healy's Community Letter Regarding Spring Break Change

div.div: The district recently distributed a survey regarding spring break, resulting in a change to spring break and the end of year date.

div.data-title: Pine Beach Celebrates World Autism Day With Series of Flipgrid Videos
div.aria-label: Pine Beach Celebrates World Autism Day With Series of Flipgrid Videos

a.h3: Pine Beach Celebrates World Autism Day With Series of Flipgrid Videos

div.div: Twenty videos of encouraging messages from PBE staff.

div.data-title: Highlights From Virtual Learning Week 3
div.aria-label: Highlights From Virtual Learning Week 3

a.h3: Highlights From Virtual Learning Week 3

div.div: At High School East, math teacher Katie Goodall's quarterly performance-based assessment (PBA) was focused on polynomials. Students in her Algebra 2 Honors class were instructed to create a portion of a roller coaster for a local theme park using a set of guidelines to draw and answer questions.

div.data-title: ASR Students Walk Away Winners at Jersey Shore Science Fair
div.aria-label: ASR Students Walk Away Winners at Jersey Shore Science Fair

a.h3: ASR Students Walk Away Winners at Jersey Shore Science Fair

div.div: April 1, 2020-- Not to be outdone by Intermediate North at the Jersey Shore Science Fair, district high schoolers made the most of their opportunities at the popular event, which went virtual this year.

div.data-title: Intermediate North Students Clean Up at Jersey Shore Science Fair
div.aria-label: Intermediate North Students Clean Up at Jersey Shore Science Fair

a.h3: Intermediate North Students Clean Up at Jersey Shore Science Fair

div.div: March 31, 2020-- Intermediate North teachers Katie Keller and Kristin Renkin were prepared to send 42 students to compete in the Jersey Shore Science Fair at Stockton University March 21.

div.data-title: #WeAreTRSchoolsInspiration Art Project Seeks to Bring Healing
div.aria-label: #WeAreTRSchoolsInspiration Art Project Seeks to Bring Healing

a.h3: #WeAreTRSchoolsInspiration Art Project Seeks to Bring Healing

div.div: March 30, 2020-- While checking her students’ amazing artwork, Cedar Grove art teacher Gina Bisogna was especially surprised by a submission from one of her second graders, Samantha Maresca.

div.data-title: Hooper Avenue School Gets 'Happy' in Video Tribute to Students
div.aria-label: Hooper Avenue School Gets 'Happy' in Video Tribute to Students

a.h3: Hooper Avenue School Gets 'Happy' in Video Tribute to Students

div.div: Led by Principal Jason Hughes and Supervisor Christine Manna, the staff at Hooper Avenue Elementary School created a video to honor their students.

div.data-title: Students Enhancing Their Life Skills at Home
div.aria-label: Students Enhancing Their Life Skills at Home

a.h3: Students Enhancing Their Life Skills at Home

div.div: March 26, 2020-- As many seek silver linings amidst the COVID-19 outbreak and the resulting school closures, event cancellations, and quarantines, it seems students across the district may have found one in the form of newly developing skills.

div.data-title: District Works With Integrity to Add Tele-Health Services for Employees
div.aria-label: District Works With Integrity to Add Tele-Health Services for Employees

a.h3: District Works With Integrity to Add Tele-Health Services for Employees

div.div: Toms River Regional Schools has taken another step to modify its practices in support of its staff and school community as COVID-19 continues to disrupt traditional models.

div.data-title: New Jersey Cancels Statewide Student Assessments
div.aria-label: New Jersey Cancels Statewide Student Assessments

a.h3: New Jersey Cancels Statewide Student Assessments

div.div: March 25, 2020 -- The district received guidance from the NJDOE regarding the cancellation of statewide student assessments due to the continued threat of COVID-19 and resulting school closures.

div.data-title: Virtual Learning: How's It Going?
div.aria-label: Virtual Learning: How's It Going?

a.h3: Virtual Learning: How's It Going?

div.div: March 24, 2020-- Toms River Regional Schools, along with countless other districts in New Jersey and throughout the country, enacted its Virtual School Day platform effective March 16 in response to COVID-19 and local and national mandates to limit travel and to practice social distancing.

div.data-title: Photo Gallery of Virtual Learning
div.aria-label: Photo Gallery of Virtual Learning

a.h3: Photo Gallery of Virtual Learning

div.div: Indeed the district set a high bar for virtual learning, and we're keeping tabs on its progress through photos. Follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook for more.

div.data-title: Bus Rebates Improve Environment, Budget
div.aria-label: Bus Rebates Improve Environment, Budget

a.h3: Bus Rebates Improve Environment, Budget

div.div: March 18, 2020-- Make it four years straight now for Toms River Regional Schools. The district was selected again to participate in the EPA’s Clean Diesel Rebate Program, this time for $100,000 in rebate funding.

div.data-title: ESS to Host Open House Hiring Events
div.aria-label: ESS to Host Open House Hiring Events

a.h3: ESS to Host Open House Hiring Events

div.div: ESS is hosting several upcoming hiring events for substitute and permanent school positions within the district.

div.data-title: District Sets High Bar for (Virtual) Classes
div.aria-label: District Sets High Bar for (Virtual) Classes

a.h3: District Sets High Bar for (Virtual) Classes

div.div: March 16, 2020-- District schools have closed for at least the next two weeks to help halt the spread of COVID-19 through social distancing, but from both school offices and teachers' homes a robust remote (virtual) learning plan kicked into gear.

div.data-title: Schools Closed 3/16-3/27 due to Coronavirus
div.aria-label: Schools Closed 3/16-3/27 due to Coronavirus

a.h3: Schools Closed 3/16-3/27 due to Coronavirus

div.div: In our effort to limit social contact to stem the spread of virus COVID-19, schools will be closed and all activities canceled Monday, March 16 to Friday, March 27. On premise office hours will be extremely limited 3/16 and 3/17. Call ahead if you have a need. Info and updates on the coronavirus page linked here. BOE meetings plan TBA pending state guidance.

div.data-title: District Hosts Third Annual Autism Summit
div.aria-label: District Hosts Third Annual Autism Summit

a.h3: District Hosts Third Annual Autism Summit

div.div: March 13, 2020-- This week Toms River Regional Schools hosted the third annual Autism Summit for Ocean County. Participants in the summit, held at the 1144 Hooper Avenue business offices, included professionals from Toms River, Lacey, Barnegat, and Berkeley.

div.data-title: LARGE SCHOOL EVENTS POSTPONED FOLLOWING STATE RECOMMENDATION
div.aria-label: LARGE SCHOOL EVENTS POSTPONED FOLLOWING STATE RECOMMENDATION

a.h3: LARGE SCHOOL EVENTS POSTPONED FOLLOWING STATE RECOMMENDATION

div.div: Large gatherings nationwide are being cancelled or postponed as a precaution against the spread of the novel coronavirus. Locally, the NJSIAA announced it will continue its athletic calendar without fans. This afternoon, Governor Phil Murphy strongly recommending the cancellation of gatherings of more than 250 people. The district will follow that recommendation until further guidance is received. Schools will post information on specific cancellations (ex. plays and other community events). Contact principals' offices if any questions.

div.data-title: Student Artwork Displayed During Youth Art Month
div.aria-label: Student Artwork Displayed During Youth Art Month

a.h3: Student Artwork Displayed During Youth Art Month

div.div: Congratulations to all of the students who exhibited artwork at the Youth Art Month Show hosted by TRRS and the Toms River Ocean County Library. An artist’s reception was held on March 9th and student artwork will be exhibited at the library through the month of March.

div.data-title: District Begins 2020 Senate and Assembly Testimonies
div.aria-label: District Begins 2020 Senate and Assembly Testimonies

a.h3: District Begins 2020 Senate and Assembly Testimonies

div.div: Last year, Toms River Regional Schools leaders, students, board members, and parents testified about state funding cuts at the Senate Budget and Appropriations Committee and Assembly Budget Committee hearings.

div.data-title: Students Sing in South Jersey Choral Festival
div.aria-label: Students Sing in South Jersey Choral Festival

a.h3: Students Sing in South Jersey Choral Festival

div.div: On Saturday, March 7th, students from East Dover Elementary and Walnut Street Elementary participated in the 37th Annual SJCDA Elementary Choral Festival.

div.data-title: With Space Complete, Project SPEAR-IT Takes Off
div.aria-label: With Space Complete, Project SPEAR-IT Takes Off

a.h3: With Space Complete, Project SPEAR-IT Takes Off

div.div: March 6, 2020-- At the beginning of the school year, High School South learned that its application for the United Way of Monmouth and Ocean Counties Youth Career Pathways grant was a winner, and that's its vision for Project SPEAR-IT (South’s Pre-Vocational Educational Alternatives Resource Institute) would be realized.

div.data-title: Superintendent Healy Releases Preliminary Draft of Budget Cuts
div.aria-label: Superintendent Healy Releases Preliminary Draft of Budget Cuts

a.h3: Superintendent Healy Releases Preliminary Draft of Budget Cuts

div.div: March 5, 2020-- On the anniversary of the district's first march on Trenton, and in preparation for upcoming senate and assembly budget hearings for the FY 2021 state budget, Superintendent David Healy has issued a letter to the community which includes a preliminary draft of cuts to the 2020-2021 district budget.

div.data-title: West Dover Hosts Cupcake Wars
div.aria-label: West Dover Hosts Cupcake Wars

a.h3: West Dover Hosts Cupcake Wars

div.div: March 5, 2020-- West Dover Elementary held its inaugural Cupcake Wars this past weekend. Four judges including Principal Mike Pallen, Mrs. Scollan, and Nicole and Amanda from Mandoli's-- the event's sponsor-- tasted more than 30 cupcakes (tough job, huh?

div.data-title: Programs Provide Sense of Community at Citta School
div.aria-label: Programs Provide Sense of Community at Citta School

a.h3: Programs Provide Sense of Community at Citta School

div.div: This year, various programs were started at Citta Elementary School to benefit its students and the school community! For example, student volunteers from High School North have been visiting weekly to mentor students and work with the after school Homework Club.

div.data-title: District Celebrates Read Across America
div.aria-label: District Celebrates Read Across America

a.h3: District Celebrates Read Across America

div.div: March 2, 2020-- Today is National Read Across America Day, which kicks off a week-long celebration of literacy, creativity, and all things Dr. Seuss. Toms River Regional Schools is taking part with great books, special guests, fun costumes, and more.

div.aria-label: Players Hit Coveted 1,000th Point Milestone

a.h3: Players Hit Coveted 1,000th Point Milestone

div.div: Congratulations to members of the district's varsity basketball teams who have scored 1,000 career points!

div.aria-label: Harlem Globetrotters at RWJBarnabas Health Arena March 4

div.div: The world-famous Harlem Globetrotters, featuring larger than life entertainers, will bring their ALL-NEW show, “Pushing the Limits,” to RWJBarnabas Health Arena next week.

div.aria-label: Community Medical Center to Host Cancer Awareness Symposium March 23

div.div: For colorectal cancer awareness.

div.data-title: Intermediate East Drama Club to Present Freaky Friday
div.aria-label: Intermediate East Drama Club to Present Freaky Friday

a.h3: Intermediate East Drama Club to Present Freaky Friday

div.div: You won't want to miss Intermediate East's performance of this new musical on Thursday, February 27th and Sunday, March 1st! For tickets, email triedrama@gmail.com.

div.data-title: High School South Theatre Guild to Present Damn Yankees
div.aria-label: High School South Theatre Guild to Present Damn Yankees

a.h3: High School South Theatre Guild to Present Damn Yankees

div.div: March 5, 6, and 7 in the HSS Cafetorium, all performances 7 p.m. Tickets, available at the door, are $5 with a student ID and $10 for general admission.

div.aria-label: Asbury Park Press Features TRRS Teacher

a.h3: Asbury Park Press Features TRRS Teacher

a.h3: High School East Theatre Co. to Perform Grease

div.div: Don't miss the Eastside Theatre Co.'s performance of Grease on March 12-14, 2020! For tickets, contact Susan Yajcaji at syajcaji@trschools.com.

div.div: Students, faculty and alumni of TRRS created a Save the Arts video to ask for one more year of funding from the NJ Department of Education by singing Seasons of Love from Jonathan Larson's Broadway musical Rent.

div.aria-label: Toms River Mayor-Elect Hill Supports Rally to Save Toms River

div.div: “The reduction in state aid to Toms River will have a devastating effect on our schools and our children and grandchildren’s education."

div.aria-label: District Responds to Emergency Aid Determination

div.aria-label: Mayor Kelaher Releases Statement in Support of Rally to Save Toms River

div.data-title: STEAM Academy Parent Meeting Dec. 9
div.aria-label: STEAM Academy Parent Meeting Dec. 9

a.h3: STEAM Academy Parent Meeting Dec. 9

div.div: At 6 p.m. in the High School East Student Center, the meeting is for incoming freshmen students looking to pursue their interests in the Academy.

div.data-title: 10th District Legislators Introduce Bill Lifting Veil of Secrecy From School Funding Process
div.aria-label: 10th District Legislators Introduce Bill Lifting Veil of Secrecy From School Funding Process

a.h3: 10th District Legislators Introduce Bill Lifting Veil of Secrecy From School Funding Process

div.div: Senator Jim Holzapfel and Assemblymen Greg McGuckin and Dave Wolfe have introduced a bill that would lift the veil from the State’s secretive methods of determining school aid allocations. The bill, A-6029, requires the Department of Education to release to school districts the data and software program used to calculate aid allocations.

div.data-title: A Heartfelt Open Letter From A Toms River Teacher To Governor Murphy
div.aria-label: A Heartfelt Open Letter From A Toms River Teacher To Governor Murphy

a.h3: A Heartfelt Open Letter From A Toms River Teacher To Governor Murphy

div.div: "In the absence of our after school programs, clubs, and sports, our district will ultimately suffer a definitive, deplorable, and depressing demise."

div.data-title: Dart Coalition, OCL, TRPD Team Up for Drug and Alcohol Awareness Program
div.aria-label: Dart Coalition, OCL, TRPD Team Up for Drug and Alcohol Awareness Program

div.div: Sponsored by the Municipal Alliance of Toms River and with funding from the Governor's Council on Alcoholism and Drug Abuse, "Truth & Consequences: A Real-World Discussion on Teen Substance Use and Underage Drinking" will be hosted at Ocean County Library Nov. 14.

div.div: Help make the Toms River Field of Dreams a reality by participating in the organization's Dine for TRFOD Event on Thursday, October 24. Visit www.tomsriverfieldofdreams.com for a list of participating Toms River restaurants.

div.data-title: 'Talk to Governor Murphy' This Wednesday
div.aria-label: 'Talk to Governor Murphy' This Wednesday

a.h3: 'Talk to Governor Murphy' This Wednesday

div.div: Murphy will join the USA TODAY NETWORK New Jersey on for a live discussion on Wednesday, June 19, where he will answer your most pressing questions. Screenshot courtesy of Thomas Costello, Asbury Park Press.

div.data-title: TRSTV Off Air
div.aria-label: TRSTV Off Air

a.h3: TRSTV Off Air

div.div: TOMS RIVER SCHOOLS TV (Channel 21 on Comcast, Channel 26 on Fios) is currently off the air. The station will return during the summer with an updated, upgraded viewing experience. Until then, watch all of their programming online and on demand at the station's YouTube channel, linked here.

div.data-title: Driven to Excellence Awards Chevy Spark to HSS Senior
div.aria-label: Driven to Excellence Awards Chevy Spark to HSS Senior

a.h3: Driven to Excellence Awards Chevy Spark to HSS Senior

div.div: Aliya Canfield was the winner during the exciting annual event, held yesterday at RWJBarnbas Health Arena thanks to Pine Belt Automotive.

div.data-title: HSS Students Hosting Walkathon to Combat Homelessness
div.aria-label: HSS Students Hosting Walkathon to Combat Homelessness

a.h3: HSS Students Hosting Walkathon to Combat Homelessness

div.div: This Saturday, June 8 from 10 a.m. to noon, a group of sophomores from High School South are raising awareness about homelessness by hosting a charity walkathon on the high school's track that will benefit the Ocean's Harbor House.

div.data-title: Opportunity ROCKS at RWJBarnabas Health Arena June 1
div.aria-label: Opportunity ROCKS at RWJBarnabas Health Arena June 1

a.h3: Opportunity ROCKS at RWJBarnabas Health Arena June 1

div.div: Sponsored by Ocean County Prosecutor Bradley Billhimer and featuring Gaten Matarazzo

div.data-title: Project Child Find Open House June 13
div.aria-label: Project Child Find Open House June 13

a.h3: Project Child Find Open House June 13

div.div: An informational open house for families of children ages 3-5 who are concerned about their child's development.

div.data-title: Academic Hall of Fame Holds Induction Ceremony
div.aria-label: Academic Hall of Fame Holds Induction Ceremony

a.h3: Academic Hall of Fame Holds Induction Ceremony

div.div: Toms River Regional Schools alumni were inducted into the Academic Hall of Fame on Sunday, May 19, 2019. Congratulations to all who were honored!

div.data-title: Holzapfel, McGuckin, Wolfe Call on Murphy to Use Extra Funds to Stop School Cuts
div.aria-label: Holzapfel, McGuckin, Wolfe Call on Murphy to Use Extra Funds to Stop School Cuts

a.h3: Holzapfel, McGuckin, Wolfe Call on Murphy to Use Extra Funds to Stop School Cuts

div.div: Senator Jim Holzapfel, Assemblyman Greg McGuckin, and Assemblyman Dave Wolfe (all R-Ocean) said any unexpected State tax revenues should be dedicated to fully funding school districts like Brick and Toms River that have been hit with massive cuts in aid under Governor Phil Murphy’s proposed FY 2020 State Budget.

div.data-title: TRPD Hosts Fun, Family-Friendly Event This Weeekend
div.aria-label: TRPD Hosts Fun, Family-Friendly Event This Weeekend

a.h3: TRPD Hosts Fun, Family-Friendly Event This Weeekend

div.div: The 2019 Community Open House will feature police, fire and EMS equipment on display; K-9 and motorcycle demonstrations; police headquarters and animal shelter tours; free bicycle helmets (while supplies last); and more.

div.data-title: A Night of Broadway Featuring Constantine Maroulis
div.aria-label: A Night of Broadway Featuring Constantine Maroulis

a.h3: A Night of Broadway Featuring Constantine Maroulis

div.div: Tony Award nominee and American Idol finalist Constantine Maroulis (Rock of Ages, Jekyll and Hyde) will be coming to High School North this Thursday, May 2 to hold a masters class and concert with Arts Academy students and NJ Thespians. The concert will begin at 7:30 p.m. in the HSN auditorium. For tickets, please visit https://friendspac.booktix.com.

div.data-title: Superintendent Healy Invites State Leaders to Toms River
div.aria-label: Superintendent Healy Invites State Leaders to Toms River

a.h3: Superintendent Healy Invites State Leaders to Toms River

div.div: A formal letter encourages Governor Murphy, Senate President Steve Sweeney, Assembly Speaker Craig Coughlin, and Commissioner of Education Lamont Repollet to Toms River to discuss Bill S2.

div.data-title: NJAEYC Presents Ocean County Children's Festival April 13
div.aria-label: NJAEYC Presents Ocean County Children's Festival April 13

a.h3: NJAEYC Presents Ocean County Children's Festival April 13

div.div: FREE family-friendly event at Ocean County Library is STEAM themed.

div.data-title: What is Juul? What is Flair?
div.aria-label: What is Juul? What is Flair?

a.h3: What is Juul? What is Flair?

div.div: Join the DART Prevention Coalition for an informative session 6-7 p.m. Monday April 15 at High School East. There has been an increase among teens in the use of devices and products used for consuming nicotine and other drugs, and the district feels it is important to share accurate information and resources on this health concern.

div.data-title: INSPIRE TR Event April 3
div.aria-label: INSPIRE TR Event April 3

a.h3: INSPIRE TR Event April 3

div.div: The special education advisory group will meet at High School East about transitioning grades and post graduation.

div.data-title: Social and Emotional Learning Parent Academy Night - Register now!
div.aria-label: Social and Emotional Learning Parent Academy Night - Register now!

a.h3: Social and Emotional Learning Parent Academy Night - Register now!

div.div: There is still time to register for the district's first annual Parent Academy Night! The academy will be held Wednesday, March 27 from 6-8 p.m. at Hooper Avenue Elementary School.

div.data-title: OCC's Beyond the Classroom Series Will Focus on Autism
div.aria-label: OCC's Beyond the Classroom Series Will Focus on Autism

a.h3: OCC's Beyond the Classroom Series Will Focus on Autism

div.div: Through this series, of which TRRS is a proud partner, Ocean County College seeks to promote awareness of autism and ignite a conversation between diverse populations in New Jersey. View the full list of events, including an April 1 workshop at East Dover Elementary School. (Temple Grandin photo courtesy of Rosalie Windard)

div.data-title: Can't Make it to Trenton? You Can Still Be Involved!
div.aria-label: Can't Make it to Trenton? You Can Still Be Involved!

a.h3: Can't Make it to Trenton? You Can Still Be Involved!

div.div:
We understand that the March 5 Trenton rally occurs during work hours for our community members, and on the heels of an early dismissal for parents and students, leaving many who cannot attend to ask: How can I help?
Here's how.

div.data-title: 'Pippin' Set to Hit the Stage at High School North
div.aria-label: 'Pippin' Set to Hit the Stage at High School North

a.h3: 'Pippin' Set to Hit the Stage at High School North

div.div: The Toms River High School North Nautical Star Theatre Company will proudly present their post-apocalyptic version of Pippin. Shows are Thursday, March 7, Friday, March 8 (ASL interpreted), and Saturday, March 9. All shows at 7 p.m. Order tickets at www.trnhs.booktix.com.

div.data-title: Cardiac and Concussion Screenings for Young Athletes
div.aria-label: Cardiac and Concussion Screenings for Young Athletes

a.h3: Cardiac and Concussion Screenings for Young Athletes

div.div: A free event at RWJBarnabas Health Arena April 13

div.data-title: Eastside Theater Company Set to Perform 'Oklahoma!'
div.aria-label: Eastside Theater Company Set to Perform 'Oklahoma!'

a.h3: Eastside Theater Company Set to Perform 'Oklahoma!'

div.div: Oklahoma! bursts onto the Toms River East stage March 14-16th. The Eastside Theater Company is thrilled to create an exciting new production of this beloved classic as part of its 75th anniversary since first opening on Broadway. For ticket information, email syajcaji@trschools.com or call 732-505-5665 ext. 210080.

div.data-title: HSS Theatre Guild to Present Cinderella
div.aria-label: HSS Theatre Guild to Present Cinderella

a.h3: HSS Theatre Guild to Present Cinderella

div.div: The Toms River High School South Theatre Guild will present Rodgers and Hammerstein's beloved fairy tale musical, Cinderella, in the school’s cafetorium on Feb 28th - March 2nd. Showtime is 7 p.m. and tickets are $10.

div.data-title: Toms River Green Team Poseidon Speaker Series to Feature TRRS's Own Dr. Natangara
div.aria-label: Toms River Green Team Poseidon Speaker Series to Feature TRRS's Own Dr. Natangara

a.h3: Toms River Green Team Poseidon Speaker Series to Feature TRRS's Own Dr. Natangara

div.div: The Toms River Green Team in partnership with Toms River Regional Schools is continuing the Poseidon Academy TRUST Speaker Series in 2019. Dr. Marc Natanagara will speak 7 p.m. Feb. 19 on “What Sustainability Means in Our Schools."

div.data-title: District Joins Lawsuit to Oppose Bill S2
div.aria-label: District Joins Lawsuit to Oppose Bill S2

a.h3: District Joins Lawsuit to Oppose Bill S2

div.div: Toms River Regional Schools has joined an alliance of school districts, municipalities, and tax payers to actively oppose the devastating financial impact caused by the reduction of state aid resulting from P.L. 2018, Chapter 67, otherwise known as S2.

div.data-title: Toms River Voters Approve Rebuilding Our Schools Initiative
div.aria-label: Toms River Voters Approve Rebuilding Our Schools Initiative

a.h3: Toms River Voters Approve Rebuilding Our Schools Initiative

div.div: Referendum passes by more than 2,100 votes.

div.data-title: Toms River Regional Robotics Teams Host Competition
div.aria-label: Toms River Regional Robotics Teams Host Competition

a.h3: Toms River Regional Robotics Teams Host Competition

div.div: ROBOTICS EVENT POSTPONED TO JAN 27 DUE TO WEATHER FORECAST! Our four Toms River Robotics Teams from High Schools East, North, and South and Intermediate North will both host and compete at the FIRST Robotics event at the RWJBarnabas Health Arena. The public is invited! For more information, go to newjerseyftc.com or click below.

div.data-title: Ocean County Prosecutor's Office Hosts Anti-Bullying Forum Nov. 15
div.aria-label: Ocean County Prosecutor's Office Hosts Anti-Bullying Forum Nov. 15

a.h3: Ocean County Prosecutor's Office Hosts Anti-Bullying Forum Nov. 15

div.div: "UNBREAKABLE" is a forum against bullying featuring Marie Unanue, Richie Sambora, and others presented by the Ocean County Prosecutor's Office. The event takes place Nov. 15 at RWJBarnabas Health Arena, and FREE tickets are available at www.rwjbarnabashealtharena.com. For more information, view the attached flyer.

div.data-title: Hooper Ave Celebrates Unity Day
div.aria-label: Hooper Ave Celebrates Unity Day

a.h3: Hooper Ave Celebrates Unity Day

div.div: Unity Day celebrates kindness, acceptance, and inclusion, and is a unified stance against bullying.

a.h3: Nominations Now Open for the 2019 Academic Hall of Fame

div.div: The Academic Hall of Fame is a prestigious honor for those showing academic, personal, and social success as a graduate of Toms River Regional Schools.

a.p: Click here to get involved and keep up the pressure to save our schools
"A Unified Effort" is Volume III of Our Story
Over the past year, the Board has discussed at public meetings the need for facilities repairs and renovations to be funded by an ESIP and referendum. Click here for more information.
